metadata.title: CVE-2022-48911 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_queue: fix possible use-after-freeEric Dumazet says:  The sock_hold() side seems suspect, because there is no guarantee  that sk_refcnt is not already 0.On failure, we cannot queue the packet and need to indicate anerror.  The packet will be dropped by the caller.v2: split skb prefetch hunk into separate change

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-177-generic - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-177-generic - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-177-lowlatency - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1128-aws - 4.15.0-1128.137~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1138-azure - 4.15.0-1138.151~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-gcp - 4.15.0-1122.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-oracle - 4.15.0-1093.102~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1128.137~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1138.151~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1122.136~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.102~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
